material.mattext: What is the full meaning of AAA?
When accessing the internet, a user needs to enter a username and a password for __________.
During user access, ________ is performed to record the users operations and online duration.
After authentication, the firewall starts to _________ the user and grant permissions for access to different resources.
The AAA process is in the order;
___________ refers to the confirmation of the user identities using various factors.
In the authentication mode, __________ includes the information that the user knows.
What i am includes unique biometric features that the user has.
The __________ includes the information that a user has.

The authentication mode has how many factors?
The following are information of a user in authentication except?
The following are functions of authorization except?
Authorizes users to access certain services
Authorizes users to access certain commands for device management
Authorizes users how to run command lines
The accounting function covers the following aspects except?
How long did the users spend the money?
What operators do users stay online?
How much money do users spend?
______ configures user information on a Network Access Server.
No authentication is performed on trusted users.
The following are user information of authentication on a Network Access Server except?
Local authentication offers ________ processing and ________ cost.
Which type of authentication mode is not recommended?
The _______ server sets up a unique database to store username and passwords for authenticating users.
Radius uses _______ at the transport layer to provide excellent real-time performance.
Radius supports a retransmission mecahnism and backup server mechanism to ensure high availability.
The Radius server performs the following functions except?
Returns authentication results to the NAS
The radius server is widely applied to the ______ and defines how user authentication and accounting information and results are transferred between the NAS and radius server.
The following are processes of exchanging radius messages except?
A user enters the username and password
_______ indicates the packet type, which occupies 1-byte.
What is the full meaning of the HWTACACS?
Huawei Terminal Access Controller Access Control System
Huawei Terminal Authorization Controller Authentic Control System
Huawei Terminal Accounting Controller Access Control System
Huawei Authentication Terminal Access Controller System

__________ is developed from the X.500 directory access protocol.

Data is organized in directory mode
Data is stored in distributed mode
A unified access point is provided for external systems.
Data query is optimized for slow read operations
A unified access point is provided foe external system is a key task of the LDAP.
The following information can be stored in the directory except ______?
The AAA provides the following authentication methods except _______?
In user management, users are allocated to ______ user groups.
The user management has the following features except?
The user organizational structure involves how many concept?
Which of the following is a user organizational structure?
_______ enables you to manage users in a dimension other than by a dimension.
An administrator is a user who access the device through the following except?
A/an __________ is an extranet entity that intranet resources.
A/an ______ is the identity entity for network access and also a basic unit for network permission management.
A remote access is mainly used to access intranet resources after accessing the internet through the following except?
_______ enhances information security and provides powerful authentication functions.
The __________ ports provides the CLI mode for device management.
_______ refers to the firewall obtaining user login information from other authentication systems instead of authenticating users so that can go online from the firewall.
In portal authentication, the firewall or a third-party server provides a portal authentication page to authenticate users.
_______ indicates that internet access users proactively access web pages for identity authentication before accessing network resources.
_______ implements authentication for internet access users when they attempt to access HTTP services.
________ refers to the authentication of various VPN access users.
_______ determine which data flows need to undergo portal authentication and authentication exemption.
An authentication policy takes effect on the following authentication modes except _______?
Possible actions that indicates how a firewall processes are as follows except _______?
_____ is implemented is implemented on data flows that meet conditions. i
During data communication, the following insecure factors may occur except _______ ?
Which of the following is a feature of the firewall?
The following are features of the firewall except?
Protecting the intranet structure is a key feature of the firewall.
______ firewalls integrates security technologies to protect private networks.
The hardware firewall provides security features such as the following except?
Which of the following is a feature of the hardware firewall?
Firewalls serves as a gateway for incoming and outgoing information.
The firewall protects the security of an intranet on the internet and the security of ______ on the intranet.
Firewalls are classified into the following types according to access control modes except?
______ firewalls can protect the entire network in a distributed manner.
The following are features of the network firewalls except?
Which of the following is a feature of the network firewalls.
Network firewalls have centralized security policies.
________ checks each packet at the network layer and forwards or discards packets based on configured security policies.
The basic principle of the packet filtering is to configure ACLS to filter data packets based on the following except ____?
The features of the packet filtering firewall is as follows except?
Packets filtering does not check session status or analyze data, which makes it easy for attackers to escape.
Which of the following are disadvantages of the packet filtering?
Static ACL rules meet dynamic security requirements.
As ACL complexity and length increase, filtering performance decreases exponentially
Packets filtering check session status, which makes it difficult for attackers to escape
Packets filtering are relatively very cheap
The ______ checks the services directly transmitted between inntranet and internet users.
The proxy applies to the application layer of the network.
The _______ firewall can completely control the exchange of network information, and the session process, achieving high security.
The proxy firewall is vulnerable to ______ attacks.
The development period of a proxy firewall is _____ and the upgrade is __________.
Stateful inspections is an extension of the _______ technology.
Data flows based on reliable connections are processed in how many phases?
The following are data flows phases based on reliable connections (TCP based data flows) except?
Stateful inspections firewalls have a fast processing of subsequent packets.
A ________ firewall uses various session tables to trace activated TCP sessions and Pseudo UDP sessions.
A _______ is a virtual connection established for the UDP data flow when UDP packets are processed.
A pseudo UDP session monitors the status of the UDP process.
The following are features of the Stateful inspection firewalls except?
Intercept data packets at the network layer
Protects packet filtering at the application layer
Extracts the status information required by securities policies from each application layer
Saves the information to the session table
The firewall network has how many network modes?
A firewall only forwards packets and does not perform routing.
In the _______ the upstream and downstream of the firewall work at the layer two and do not have IP addresses.
As a network security mechanism, packet filtering mainly controls the forwarding of many traffic across the network.
_________ control traffic forwarding according to specified rule and apply integrated content security detection to traffic.
___________ controls the network communication through the firewall.
Which of the following is a key function of the security policies?
The ________ that matches the security policies are allowed to pass through firewalls.
The basic function of the firewall is to protect a network from being attacked by any untrust network while permitting legitimate communication between two networks.

In firewall application, ________ are a basic means of the network security access to the data flows passing through the firewall, and determine whether subsequent application data flows are processed.
The following are traffic and attitudes analyzed by the firewall except?
_________ firewalls match packets one by one with packet filtering rules.
Inspection on the packets that match a session takes a much shorter time than the packets than on the packets that do not match a session.
When the ______ is mechanism is enabled, a session can be created only when the first packet passes the inspection performed by the firewall.
For TCP packets,if stateful inspection is ______ , a session is created as long as a packet that does not match any sessions match any session pass the inspections
In the UDP packets, stateful inspection is a ________ protocol.
If a _____ packet does not match any sessions and passes the inspection, a session is created.
_______ is the basis of a stateful inspection firewall.
The session table on the NGFW contains how many elements?
The session table on the NGFW contains the following elements except?
Which of the following is an element of the session table on the NGFW?
User is an element of the session table on the NGFW.
In the _______ process, the firewall matches the packet with security policies.
The security policies on the NGFW perform the following functions except?
Distinguish employees from different departments based on users, making network management more flexible and visualized.
Distinguish between applications using the same protocol, achieving refined network management.
Inspect content security and block viruses and hacker intrusions to better protect internal networks.
Inspect the data flow of the stateful inspection to make it easier and accessible.
The security policies on the NGFW inspect content security and block viruses and hacker intrusions to better protect internal networks.
The procedure for creating a security zone is in the order;
Set security zone parameters &gt; click add &gt; Choose Network &gt; zone
Choose Network &gt; zone &gt; click add &gt; set security zone parameters
Choose Network &gt; click add &gt; zone &gt; set security zone parameters
Choose Network &gt; zone &gt; set security zone parameters &gt; click add

The security configuration roadmap classify employees by source IP address or users.
______ use security policies to determine the permissions of user groups and then those of the privilege users.

List the parameters in the security policies
Sort the policies from the most specific to the least specific
Protect the security policies from malicious attacks
_______ uses only one port during communication.
_______ maintains information about connections in its own data structure and uses the information to create temporary rules.
ASPF enables the firewall to support the protocols of multi data connections over one control channel.
The ASPF performs the following functions except?
Enables the firewall to support the protocols of multi data connections over one control channel
Supports various security policies in very complex application scenarios
Monitors the ports used by each application connection
Supports the firebase from hazardous softwares
In a ________ protocol, the control channel is seperated from the data channel.
Port application is also known as ______?
_______ is used by the firewall to identify application-layer protocol packet that use non-standard ports.
Ports mapping supports the following application-layer protocols except?
A/an _______ is a collection of a sequential rules used by a device to filter network traffic.
ACLs are classified by the following types except _____?

The fragment cache prevents the firewall from discarding fragments.
The firewall suppots the persistent connection function only for TCP packets.
_______ can be collected from network devices or terminal devices.
Data monitoring and analysing can reveal network security risks and strengthen the network.
If a security event occurs, _____ help rapidly locate the threat, and provide support for defense and event investigation.
_____ evaluates network security before attacks occur, rectify the identified issues and strengthen the network.

What is the first method in the security assessment ?
How many security assessment methods do we have?

The following are scanner types except ?

Uses Ping to check whether IP addresses are available
Checks service types provided by target computers
Checks whether the target scope of certain computers are available
Checks whether the ping used is right or wrong

________uses PING to check whether IP addresses are reachable
_________ a network scanning and sniffing toolkit in Linux.

Click all programs &gt; Click Application gathering &gt; Nmap

The first step in the penetration process is __________
The following are features of the questionnaire styles except ________?
The following are features of the questionnaire scope except ______?
The following are data collection methods except _____?
______ enables a device to copy the packets passing through a mirrored mirrored port and send them to a specified observing port for analysis and monoitoring.
________ service logs are generated in dataflow format so that they can be viewed on the log server
______ session logs are output in binary format and consume few network resources.
The firewall can also export session logs in Netflow format to a log sever for the administrator to analyze IP packets flows on the network.
The following are types of the Window logs except __?
_______ includes events recorded by the application or system programs.
The security log records the system security audit events.
The following are system security audit events except ________?
The following are events generated by the operating system components except ?
An event of successful operations of an application,driver or service is termed as__________.
____________ is neither a direct nor major event but will lead to potential issues.
______ refer functions unavailability and data loss.
___________ refers to login audit in a way that the user attempts to access the network drive but fails.
______ event refer to the access attempts such as object access, priviledge use,security logs recording login or logout.
Logs record all events of the operating system.
An operating system is a software program.
______ manages all hardware resources and controls the execution of softwares.
An operating system is an interface between computers and ________.
An operating system improves the human-machine interaction interface.
The main task of the ______ is to allocate, control and manage processor resources.
A ______ is the basic unit for the allocation and running of processor resources.
The following are processor management except?
Which of the following is a processor management?
Process synchronization is a processor management.
Memory management provides the following except?
The main task of memory management is to allocate memory resources to programs and manage these resources.
______ facilitates memory usage and logical expressions.
_______ executes i/o requests, classify i/o devices, facilitates CPU and i/o device usage
Device management provides the following except?
Programs and data are stored as _______ in modern computers.
The main task of the ______ is to manage user and system files.

File management facilitates file usage and security.
Job management provides the following functions except?
The main task of the _______ is to provide a stable environment suitable for users to effectively organize their workflows.

By the number of supported users
By the openness of source code

the oppeness of the source code

Process management can be included in process management.

Which of the following is a closed-source operating system?
MS-DOS is a single-user operating system.

The following are Linux operating systems except?
The following are features of the Linux operating system except?

_______ ensures the integrity of data transit using hash algorithms.
______ the confidentility of data in transit using symmtric and asymmetric encryption.
______ ensures the non-repudiation of data transmission by authenticating the public key using a third-party authority.

The cryptology applications are applied to the following listed scenarios except ________?
A ______ is a private data channel estabablished across a shared public network.
_____ users can use customize a best suited to the needs.
______ users can use the toll lines of the Internet to set up their own private networks, without requiring physical dedicated toll lines.

The following are layers of the VPN except ______?

The client to site VPN is a connection between the following _____?

The L2TP VPN is applied to the following scenarios except?
The main function of the L2TP VPN is to provide support for the tunnel transmission of packets at the PPP link layer.
GRE encapsulates the packets of the folloiwing network protocols except?
What is the name of the channel used for transmitting packets over a heterogenous networks?
General Routing Encapsulation is what type of technology?
Which of the following is not an IPsec VPN security protection mechanism for end-to-end IP packages?
The IPsec protocol suite is a series of protocols developed by the ________?
An IPsec VPN is a network layer VPN established through an IPsec tunnel.
IPsec secures transmission of IP packets using how many security protocols?
Authentication header is a security protocol of the IPsec.
The IPsec _______ needs to be established between IPsec peers before IPsec implements secure data transmission.
The SA is not an agreement between IPsec peers in communication.
The transport-layer protocol header in the encapsulation transport mode protects the following except?
The ________ serves the IPsec SA by providing key negotiation and establishing the IPsec SA.
_______ provides secure connections for TCP-based application layer protocols.
The following are the main functions of the SSL VPN except?
Port forwarding is a key function of the SSL VPN.
The GRE configuration follows which procedure?
GRE. click add &gt; GRE &gt; Choose network
Ensapsulation security payload is a security protocol of the GRE.
______ ensures the security of data transmission on the network and protects data from tampering and spying.
_______ technologies ensure data integrity and prove the identity of the data sender.
PKI certicate authentication technologies verify the validity of public keys and ensure that users access secure legitimate networks.
How many types of symmetric cryptography algorithms do we have?
_______ algorithm continuosly inputs elements and generates one output element at a time.
A stream algorithm is used for the following except?
______ encrypts a one-byte of a plain-text at a time, and the key is input into a pseudo random byte generator to generate an apparently byte.
Plaintext blocks and the key are input in the encryption algorithm.
The following are block cipher types except ?
A pseudo random byte generator used to generate an apparently random byte stream is called __________?
Which of the following is a stream algorithm type?
The algorithm commonly used in public key cryptography includes the following except?
Digital Signature Algorithm is a commonly used public key cryptography.
The DH algorithm is used by how many parties?
_______ can resist all password attacks and has been recommended by the ISO as the public key data encryption standard.
_____ is the first algorithm to be used for both encryption and digital signature.
The DSA performs the following functions except?
________ is based in discrete logarithm problems in finite field and delivers the same level of security as RSA.
In DSA signature and authentication, the sender uses his or her own private key to sign the file or message.
_______ converts the input of any length into the output of a fixed length.
The following are hash algorithms except?
______ can compress large volume information into a confidential format before the information is signed by the digital signature software with the private key.
The MD5 can be used for secure access authentication.
Which of the following is used by digital envelope?
As security issues frequently occur, effective security operations cannot be solely achieved through security services.
Security operations are the combination of the following except?
The following are basic operations conditions for security except?
The incident prevention and response manage log and monitor behaviour.
The disaster recovery plan performs the following functions except?
The following are funtions performed by the incident prevention and response except?

Investigation and forensics understands the requirements for investigation and forensics.
Which of the following are not BCP emergency responses that enhances the ability of an enterprise to recover from destructive incidents immediately.

Which of the following is the last step in BCP?
________ identifies which resources can sustain the development of the organization.
Business impact assessment performs the following functions to the resources except?
Business Impact Assessment consists of the following except?

BCP provides process guidance for handling emergencies and responding to threat incidents as soon as possible to minimize impacts on organizations.
When a service is interrupted due to a disaster, the _____ takes effect, instructing the emergency response personnel to restore services to the normal state.
What is the first step in the disaster recovery plan?
In order to successfully prosecute a crime, sufficient __________ must be provided to prove the crime.
Evidence types include the following except __________?
Natural evidence is a type of evidence.
Which of the following is a type of evidence?
The first process in the investigation and forensic process is _____?
Which of the following is not an investigation and forensic process?
Documentary evidence is not an evidence type.
The following are characteristics of the cybercrime except _______?
Use of computers to store information related to criminal activities ii. Direct use of computers as a crime tool to launch criminal activities. iii. Use of computers to solve security problems
In violation of legal regulations, bad actor deliberately ________

Invades a computer information system or compromises the functionality of the system and its related data and its application. ii. Produces or disseminates computer virus. iii. Affect the normal operation of the system or causes detrimental effects.
Many members and lowering age is a feature of a cybercrime.
Which of the following is a motive of the cybercrime?
________ are idle and dull people with some skills who want to access all interested websites.
__________ are people who are learning about computers and network perform misoperations or accidentally discover a vulnerability that may affect data.
______ are people who are employed to intrude into a target system to steal or tamper with information for huge financial gain
The following are features of Political action of the cybersecurity motive except _______?
_____ are people who want to prove their competence and win respect and recognition from their counterparts.
Cybercrimes takes the following forms except _____?
______ is information stored or transmitted in binary form during the operation of a computer or computer system and is used in a court case .
Digital evidence is also known as ______
The following are examples of the digital evidence except _______?
Digital evidence has the following features except __________?
________ digital evidence depends heavily on computer and storage technologies.
________ digital evidence can reflect a dynamic and continous project that vividly reproduces the scene.
_______ attackers use hacker methods to invade computer systems and steal passwords in order to arbitrarily tamper with electronic data, making it difficult to validate evidence.
Digital evidence cannot be transmitted or saved without high-tech equipments.
________ refers to the proces of confirming, protecting, extracting, archiving and presenting at a court digital evidence that exists in computers and related peripherals.
The following are principles of Digital forensics except ?
______ collects evidence as soon as possible and ensure it is not damaged.
Which of the following are changes in evidence from when it is initially collected to when it is initially collected to when it is officially presented.
The entire examination forensic examination must be supervised.
The comprehensiveness principle performs the following functions ______ ii. Comprehensively analyze files iii. Provide necessary expert testimony
Search all files in the targeted system
It is essential to collect evidence as soon as possible during forensics to ensure that it is not damaged.
Before digital forensic is performed, _______ the target computer system so that the criminal suspect damage evidence.
The forensic tools are the hardware tools and the ______ tools.
__________ mirrors the content of a hard disk to ensure that the data in the original hard disk is not modified.
________ blocks the write channel of the hard disk to ensure that the data in the storage medium is not modified during data obtaining and analysis, thereby ensuring data integrity.
Forensic tower provides the following functions except?
The following are software forensic tools except ____?
_____ is a forensic application completed integrated with Windows UI.
The following are functions of the Encase tool except ________?
Forensics can be implemented even when the phone is damaged.
Digital forensics is related to the following technologies except ______?
The following are evidence preservation technologies excepet _______?
A/an ______ is a digital evidence that proves the generation time of certain data.
The public key in asymmetric key pair of a digital envelope is used for information security verification.
The following are principles of Digital Evidence Verification except ______?
The judicial verifier of electronic data independently expresses verification opinions without external inteference.
The judicial verification of electronic data should be supervised by the investigator or by the public.
The following are evidence analysis technologies except ________?
What is the purpose of tracing?
The following are tracing technologies except _____?
The Log analysis inludes the following except _____?
The following are criteria for electronic data verification except ______?

The preservation of evidence directly affects the legal effect of the evidence.
______ is used to simulate a mobile phone in order to restore the chat history and group discussion information.

Saves certificate files in binary format.
PEM saves certificate in ASCII format.

PKI uses public keys to provide security service for all network applicationns.

A typical campus network contains the following except?

The aggregation layer converges traffic and control policies?
The ______ layer offers access modes to devices.
______ is designed to overcome the interconnection difficulties and low efficiency issues associated with using various protocols by defining an open and interconnected network.
The OSI model reference model forms the basis for computer network communications?
The OSI model has how many layers?
The following are the top three layers of the OSI model except?
______ provides media access and link management.
Which of the following is the bottom four layers of the OSI model?
The transport layer establishes E2E connection for hosts?
In the OSI model, units of data are collectively called ____ ?
Units of data of the Application layer is known as the ____?
The Transport layer transmits bit streams over a transmission medium .
The main task of the _____ are to control the physical layer and allow it to present an error-free link to the network layer, detect and correct any errors,and perform traffic control.
The network layer is responsible for forwarding packets and checks the network topology to determine the optimal route for transmission.

_______ device calculates the optimal route to the destination by running a routing protocol such as RIP, identifies the network device to which the data packet by using the network layer protocol, and sends the data to the next hop by using the service provided by the lower layer.
_______ is responsible for providing effective and reliable services to users.
The ______ model is widely used due to its openness and usability.
The following are TCP/IP model layers except?
________ layer provides network interfaces for applications.
The Internet layer performs addressing and routing.
The _____ is used to transfer data from one host to another.
The ________ is used to convert the domain name of the host to an IP address.
The _____ provides reliable connection-oriented communications services for applications and applies to application that requires responses.
The UDP provides connectionless communications and does not guarantee reliable transmission of data packets?
Which of the following is a layer of the TCP/IP model?
In the encapsulation process, the user data is first transmitted to the application layer, and the application layer information is added.

________ is used for communications between users in different network segments.
SNMP is a network device management protocol.
____ is used to test network connectivity.

SNMP requests packets are encapsulated in Ethernet frames.
The _______ request packet contains the source IP address, destination IP address, source MAC address and destination MAC address.
After receiving the ____ request packet, each host checks whether the target protocol address matches its IP address.
After an IP address is emcompassed to the host, the IP address must be checked to ensure tork and doshat it is unique on the netw ork and does not conflict with another address.
The _____ sends ARP request packages to detect address conflits.
______ is used to send control packets between IP network devices to transmit error, control or query messages.

The Ping command output contains the following except?
_____ traces the forwarding path of packets hop by hop based on the TTL value in the packet header.

The SNMP includes the followin except?
The eSight NTA provides a convenient way to monitor and analyse networks.
Which of the following is a function of the eSight NTA?
_____ is a Huawei-patented technology used to collect and distribute statistics about network traffic.
________ is used to resolve Domain names to IP addresses.
The DNS involves the following servers in resolution except?
When used to transmit data, _____ establishes a control connection and a data connection between the server and the client.
HTTP relies on TCP to achieve connection-oriented state and does not have encryption and verification mechanism.
The HTTP has how many types of packets?
______ defines how PCs send mail to an SMTP server and how mails are transferred between SMTP servers.
In the communications field, firewalls are mainly used to protect a network against attacks and intrusions from other networks.
_______ is a type of program tool that is used to remove known harmful program code, such as viruses from the computer.
A ______ is a method of seperating private networks from public networks.

Which of the following is a firewall classified by form?

Standalone firewalls are firewalls classified by protected object.

_____ is a free packet filtering firewall.

Which of the following is a phase undergone by the Iptable?
The following are phases undergone by the iptable except?
A table consists of chains, and chains consists of ______?
An iptable rule specifies quintuple information including the following except?
If a data packet matches a rule, _____
The packet is processed according to the rule
The packet is processed according to the chain
The chain is processed according to the rule
The protocol is processed according to the chain
If a data matches an iptables rules, iptables process the packets according to the _______.
A ________ is a path for transmitting data packages.
When a data packet reaches a chain, ______ matches the packet with the first rule with the chains and checks whether the packets meet the conditions defined in the rule.
If the packet does not match any rule in the chain, the default policy in the chain is used.
The iptables contains the following tables except?
The iptables contains how many types of tables?
_____ determines whether data packets are processed using the state track mechanism.
The table priority is in the order ______?
